DataflowEvent.title: DataflowEvent
DataflowEvent.description: The envelope for events on in the dataflow streams.

VersionSet.title: VersionSet
VersionSet.description: A list of the versions of resources which were current when another resource or record was created. Each item is a string with the form tag:id@version.

x-tag-prefixes.shape: Shape - the version of a shape
x-tag-prefixes.sd: ShapeData - the data version for a shape
x-tag-prefixes.job: Job - the version of a job
x-tag-prefixes.jd: JobData - the data version of a job
x-tag-prefixes.merge: MergeRule - the version of a merge rule
x-tag-prefixes.match: MatchRule - the version of a match rule
x-tag-prefixes.dq: DataQuality - the version of a data quality rule
x-tag-prefixes.enr: Enrichment - the version of an enrichment
x-tag-prefixes.rel: Relationship - the version of a relationship

Resource.title: Resource
Resource.description: A representation of a resource provided by some microservice.

typ.title: Type
typ.description: The type, used to discriminate between payloads.

nrn.title: Nrn
nrn.description: The Naveego Resource Name of the resource. Format is "nrn:{domain}:[tenant]:{microservice}:{type}:{id}[@version]".

name.title: Name
name.description: The display name of the resource.

DataflowEventEmpty.title: DataflowEventEmpty
DataflowEventEmpty.description: The metadata for events on in the dataflow streams, with no payload.

id.title: ID
id.description: A unique identifier for the event.

tid.title: TenantID
tid.description: The ID of the tenant this event belongs to.

sid.title: SourceID
sid.description: The NRN of the source that generated this event.

jid.title: JobID
jid.description: The NRN of the job that generated this event.

bid.title: BatchID
bid.description: The NRN of the batch (run of a job) that generated this event.

rid.title: RecordID
rid.description: A value that uniquely represents the record or resource most relevent to the event.

rids.title: RecordIDs
rids.description: The RID value for each event bundled into this event.

cid.title: CorrelationID
cid.description: A value used to track the event's movement through the system and to assign causality. If there is a one-to-one relationship between two dataflow events, they should have the same cid.

czid.title: CauseID
czid.description: A value used to assign causality. If this dataflow event was caused by another dataflow event, this czid should be the id of the causing event.

m.title: Metadata
m.description: Metadata to be transferred with the event.

DataflowEventWithDatapoint.title: DataflowEventWithDataPoint
DataflowEventWithDatapoint.description: The envelope for a dataflow-event which always will only have datapoint as the payload.

Payload.title: Payload
Payload.description: The envelope for events on in the dataflow streams.

typ.title: The type, used to discriminate between payloads.
typ.x-ms-client-name: The type, used to discriminate between payloads.

m.title: Metadata
m.description: Metadata defined as part of the payload, used when components need to add custom info to standard payloads.

Trace.description: A trace records stats for a step that an event has gone through.

ts.title: Timestamp
ts.description: Timestamp indicating when the step started.

d.title: Duration
d.description: The time it took to complete the step, in nanoseconds.

Heartbeat.description: A tracer used for monitoring latency and providing a keep-alive heartbeat for long-running jobs.

DataPoint.title: DataPoint
DataPoint.description: DataPoint is an object containing arbitrary data.

s.title: ShapeID
s.description: The ShapeID@Version of the shape to which this datapoint belongs.

z.title: SchemaID
z.description: The SchemaID@Version of the schema which produced the original record this datapoint was mapped from.

c.title: ConnectionID
c.description: The ConnectionID@Version of the connection used to produce this data point.

d.title: Data
d.description: The data for this data point.

zd.title: SchemaData
zd.description: Data from the original record which has been captured in this datapoint to facilitate writebacks or lineage analysis.

enr.title: EnrichedData
enr.description: Enriched data for this data point.

v.title: DataVersion
v.description: A monotonically increasing number which is incremented when previous datapoints from the same job as this datapoint should be discarded rather than updated.

BatchStart.title: BatchStart
BatchStart.description: Start indicates a batch has started.

maxDurationSeconds.title: MaxDurationSeconds
maxDurationSeconds.description: The maximum time this batch should take to complete, in seconds.

count.title: Expected count
count.description: Optional; the number of records expected in this job, if it can be predicted.

rate.title: Expected rate
rate.description: Optional; the maximum number of milliseconds expected between data points or heartbeats. If the rate is provided the receiver will be able to detect timeouts more accurately.

transferMode.title: Transfer mode
transferMode.description: Identifies the transfer mode of the data contained in the batch, default: streaming

v.title: DataVersion
v.description: A monotonically increasing number which is incremented when data from previous batches of this job should be discarded.

BatchEnd.title: BatchEnd
BatchEnd.description: End indicates a batch has ended.

count.title: Count
count.description: The number of records the batch thinks it sent, so that receivers can detect data loss.

reason.title: Reason
reason.description: Specifies the reason the job ended.

message.title: Message
message.description: A message about why the job ended. Usually only relevent if the job failed.

contentUrl.title: Content url
contentUrl.description: Optional; The URL to obtain the content for the batch

BadRecord.title: BadRecord
BadRecord.description: BadRecord represents a record that had some problem at some step. The data point should be propegated but no step should attempt any further processing.

dataPoint.description: The original data point, before something went wrong.

errorStep.description: Something that identifies the step where the problem happend.

problems.description: Problems that individual properties in the record had.

ResourceCreated.title: ResourceCreated
ResourceCreated.description: Emitted when a resource is created.

ResourceDeleted.title: ResourceDeleted
ResourceDeleted.description: Emitted when a resource is deleted.

ResourceUpdated.title: ResourceUpdated
ResourceUpdated.description: Emitted when a resource is updated.

b.title: Before
b.description: The state of the resource before the change.

a.title: After
a.description: The state of the resource after the change.

id.title: ID
id.description: The ID of the resource this status belongs to.

MatchGroup.title: MatchGroup
MatchGroup.description: A representation of a match group provided by some microservice.

typ.title: Type
typ.description: The type, used to discriminate between payloads.

v.title: Version
v.description: The version of the group, incremented each time a new version of this group is produced for any reason.

matchData.title: MatchData
matchData.description: The match data used to construct this group.

CompositeRecord.title: CompositeRecord
CompositeRecord.description: A representation of a composite record provided by some microservice.

typ.title: Type
typ.description: The type, used to discriminate between payloads.

v.title: Version
v.description: The version of this composite, incremented whenever a new  is emitted for any reason.

values.title: Values
values.description: The values of the properties as determined by the merge rules.

displayName.title: DisplayName
displayName.description: The string used to label this record when it is displayed to a user.

linked.title: Linked
linked.description: The composite records this record is linked to by relationships.

doNotWriteback.title: DoNotWriteback
doNotWriteback.description: Should this composite record be written back?

brokenQualityRules.title: BrokenQualityRules
brokenQualityRules.description: The quality rule ids applied to this composite record

MassSyncJob.title: MassSyncJob
MassSyncJob.description: Mass sync job indicates that a mass sync job has been requested.

jobID.title: JobID
jobID.description: The id of the target writeback job.

CSCJob.title: CSCJob
CSCJob.description: CSC job indicates that a csc job has been requested.

Notification.title: Notification
Notification.description: A representation of notification to be delivered to a user.

typ.title: Type
typ.description: The type, used to discriminate between payloads.

topic.title: Topic
topic.description: The topic the notification is targeting.

message.title: Message
message.description: The notification message to be delivered.

text.title: Text
text.description: A plain text version of the message.

short.title: Short
short.description: A short plan text version of the message.

html.title: Html
html.description: An HTML formatted version of the message

CompositeLink.title: CompositeLink
CompositeLink.description: Represents a link between the composite it is found on and another composite.

relId.title: RelationshipId
relId.description: The ID of the Relationship in Metabase that defines the rules which created this link.

ruleId.title: RuleId
ruleId.description: The ID of the Rule within the Relationship in Metabase which created this link.

rid.title: RecordId
rid.description: The ID of the record at the other end of this link.

n.title: DisplayName
n.description: The display name of the record at the other end of this link.

EnrichmentMetadata.title: EnrichmentMetadata
EnrichmentMetadata.description: Contains information about the run of an enrichment step.

timestamp.title: Timestamp
timestamp.description: The UTC time the enrichment step last ran.

messages.title: Messages
messages.description: Messages logged by the enrichment step.

error.title: Error
error.description: The error logged by the enrichment step, if any.

events.title: Values
events.description: Values set by the enrichment step, if any.

PropertyVersion.title: PropertyVersion
PropertyVersion.description: A value of a property in the composite, with details about where it came from.

info.title: Swagger for Dataflow Events
info.description: This is a swagger for dataflow events. There's no actual API for this, it's just to help with client generation and documentation. The swagger-generated.json file has all the definitions from the events folder included in in; it is generated by the generate-swagger.csx script at the root of this repo.

post.description: Expects events with payloads including DataPoint, BatchStart, BatchEnd, Heartbeat, and BadRecord.
Expects events with a Group payload.
Expects events with a CompositeRecord payload.
Expects events with a ResourcePayload payload: ResourceUpdated, ResourceCreated, or ResourceDeleted.
